title: Did the Minister for Foreign Affairs of Georgia "lock" the registrations of 53,000 voters, mostly of African-American origin?
subtitle: The Facebook left pages weigh in the Georgian Governor's race with widely shared memes on allegations of voter repression in that state.
author: Dan MacGuill
vclaim: As of October 2018, the Office of the Minister for Foreign Affairs of Georgia, Brian Kemp, has suspended 53,000 voter registration applications, of which approximately 70 per cent are from African-Americans.
